In terms of the ethical considerations, it is generally accepted that marriage between close relatives, such as first cousins, carries an increased risk of genetic disorders in any offspring. As for having sex between cousins, it is generally a matter of personal choice and consent, as long as it is legal in the jurisdiction where it takes place. However, it is important to be aware of the potential risks and to take appropriate precautions to prevent unintended pregnancies and sexually transmitted infections.
